sub_title: Associate Professor at Delft University of Technology
summary:
Ryoichi Ishihara (1967) is an associate Professor and head of the Quantum Integration Technology in the Quantum and Computer Engineering department in Delft University of Technology (TUDelft). He is currently a principal investigator in QuTech and a member of Kavli Institute of Nanoscience. He is also a visiting professor of Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology since 2013 and a specially appointed associate Professor in Tokyo Institute of Technology. 

He received the PhD in Physical Electronics from Tokyo Institute of Technology (1996). After moving to TU Delft in the same year, he has established new activity of large area electronics using thin-film transistors (TFTs). He has done and continues research on single-grain and printed silicon TFTs for 3D integration and biodegradable/flexible electronics. His current research in QuTech are (1) integration of interface electronics with silicon spin qubit by monolithic integration and advanced packaging technologies for scalable quantum computer and (2) integration engineering of diamond color centers for scalable quantum computer and sensor applications. 

He is a co-author of more than 90 journal papers and 120 international conference papers and a co-inventor of 13 granted patent families.
Highlights of Ishihara’s career include the first demonstration of TFTs inside large Si grain (1996), the location- and orientation-control of Si crystals (2000, 2006) by laser crystallization, the monolithic 3D-IC using single-grain TFTs (2008), the ultra-high mobility Ge TFTs (2010), and carbon nanotube vertical interconnect via’s (2013), and the first solution processed flexible Si TFTs on a plastic (2013) and paper (2014).

profile_positions.description: - Research on quantum integration technology for scalable quantum computer and communication
profile_positions.title: Scientist

profile_positions.description: Conducting research on high mobility thin-film transistors and education on course works (solid-state physics and advanced electronic materials) and individual supervision (currently 5PhDs and 1MSc students).
profile_positions.title: Associate Professor

profile_positions.description:
- Research on high-mobility single-grain Si TFTs and circuits, location and crystallographic orientation control of Si grains and characterization and atomic modeling of coincident site lattice (CSL) boundaries of Si with EBSD, SSRM, SCM and DFT simulation
- Individual supervisions for 5 PhD, 3 MSc and 1 BSc students
- Lecture for MSc (Thin-Film Transistor Technology)
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description:
- Setting up Large Area Electronics research activity (deposition and crystallization equipments, TFT fabrication, device simulation, transistor layout design, electrical measurement)
- Research on excimer-laser crystallization, location control of silicon grains, crystallographic orientation analysis of poly-Si grain by EBSD (electron backscattering diffraction), investigation of melt and solidification process during laser crystallization by time-resolved optical reflectivity (TROR) and simulation of melt and solidification process by phase-field model
- Individual supervisions of MSc and PhD students
- Gave a lecture course (TFT technology)
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral research scientist

profile_positions.description: Conducting research at Quantum Computing Unit of Institute of Innovative Research through Tokyo Tech World Research Hub Initiative (WRHI)
profile_positions.title: Specially Appointed Associate Professor

profile_positions.description: Conducting research and education as a Visiting Professor at School of Material Science, Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (JAIST)
profile_positions.title: Visiting Professor

profile_positions.description:
- Overall management of research program
- High mobility single-grain Si TFTs on Gen1 pilot-line
- Patent filing
- Knowledge transfer
profile_positions.title: Principal investigator
